channel.title: Duping, in rs2 ? O.o
channel.description:
Ok, I was browsing the Runescape forums and found stumbled across this.
* attached at bottom *
Now, would that possibly cause dupes ?
Say someone traded a Yellow Party Hat for 200m The player who received the party hat then logs out before the Disconnect. Then, the player who received the 200m gets disconnected, and receives the party hat again ?
I'm not sure, JaGex are smarter than that. But yeah... Post opinions / thoughts

item.title: Duping, in rs2 ? O.o
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

chrisn2323:

“Was” implies it.

No.

Read full topic

item.title: Duping, in rs2 ? O.o
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“bakatool, post:22, topic:198319”]FACT about DUPING

only way to dupe in rs2 would be to mess with their sql packet processing if you create a big enough queue of sql queries on the server longer then it would take to process lets say you logging in and out then you could dupe this is called a universal dupe works on mostly ALL MMORPG’s due to the fact that MMORPG’s nowday run 3 servers
database server, login server, and a bunch of game servers.

If the database server gets enough stress that it self atleast 20 seconds to process it all thats about 30,000 queries +++

then after you logout and login you could give your item to your friend relog again you will see that you still have the item in your inventory after relogging thats because your data wasn’t really saved but not you FOOLED with the game server’s memory server side yes… you created a item fooling the game server into thinking the player you loaded already has the items which he does do the SQL not updating your information fast enough.

The way this bug worked in many mmorpgs i’ve played people usually after cracking the crypt that makes packets find one packet they could spam to server without corrupting the protocol of packets so you don’t get a expell or disconnect right away. They would usally spam a packet that has connection to SQL but overlooked by the creators of the game mostly like a… guild system/ squadron system. Doing a packet event in order extremely fast around 900~1000 packets per second leaving/making a guild system created alot of stress.

Anyways this dupe worked on Diablo, Helbreath, Lineage, Legend Of Mir, MUOnline World of Warcraft all very popular game and yet all had a similar bug.

Runescape only uses SQL on login/logout so its extremely rare that you will get anywhere so just words of wisdom dupes are not as hard as you may think.

As for gold duplication thats also something thats somewhat universal but even more rare to find then database server stress. I ain’t gonna say much about this one cause I have my reasons all I can say as advise, the games client is dumber then the server it self and studing the packet the client sends is the key to doing anything use your minds and send something the client can’t possibly send on its own.[/quote]

This is all complete bullshit, thanks for playing.

Read full topic

item.title: Duping, in rs2 ? O.o
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

I would imagine it combines both. Periodic saves every x minutes/seconds/whatever of everybody logged on, + a save just for you if you log out/disconnect.

They obviously force a save before shutting down the servers, though. Rollbacks only happen when something breaks.

Read full topic

item.title: Duping, in rs2 ? O.o
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:34, topic:198319”][quote author=ninja nub link=topic=262982.msg2199293#msg2199293 date=1208678927]

No. That means you are reset to a previous date. Just like moparscape stores character files, they store 10-20 minute, and even day backups of your character. They just roll back to that. The best way to make millions quick USED to be to raid all the rune stores after a system update, if you could hit 10 stores and buy all their runes, you could make 10-20m in minutes. I’ve done it, but not for that much profit. There’s alot of competition.

YOU ARE AN IDIOT! Jagex saves every second! That is why if you x-log, you’re still at the same place.
[/quote]

Or it just saves when the connection is lost…?[/quote]

What’s the point if it constantly updates?

But now I’m getting confused. If my theory, it saves every second, is correct, why doesn’t it update to the high scores? Is that too much for the update server to handle?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“mvp566, post:4, topic:198319”]I think i heard this somewhere on some site, never cared to think bout it…

Rs updates with say 1 minute so there is the “update in : 60”

Player 1 trade player 2 a Y-Phat right before d/c on update
Player 2 Buys it, logs out
player 1 is d/c’d right after from update and keeps phat[/quote]

item.title: Duping, in rs2 ? O.o
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:29, topic:198319”][quote author=cooper link=topic=262982.msg2188007#msg2188007 date=1208241824]
RuneScape saves player information during play as well, doesn’t it? That would access the SQL.
[/quote]

I believe hiscores refresh on logout, which is what he is referring to. Complete bullshit, because the server would still have to store your information somewhere if your stats change and you don’t log out.[/quote]
I think sometimes they even refresh while playing [after a large amount of time] but I haven’t checked that in a while.

Read full topic

item.title: Duping, in rs2 ? O.o
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“bakatool, post:22, topic:198319”]FACT about DUPING

only way to dupe in rs2 would be to mess with their sql packet processing if you create a big enough queue of sql queries on the server longer then it would take to process lets say you logging in and out then you could dupe this is called a universal dupe works on mostly ALL MMORPG’s due to the fact that MMORPG’s nowday run 3 servers
database server, login server, and a bunch of game servers.

If the database server gets enough stress that it self atleast 20 seconds to process it all thats about 30,000 queries +++

then after you logout and login you could give your item to your friend relog again you will see that you still have the item in your inventory after relogging thats because your data wasn’t really saved but not you FOOLED with the game server’s memory server side yes… you created a item fooling the game server into thinking the player you loaded already has the items which he does do the SQL not updating your information fast enough.

The way this bug worked in many mmorpgs i’ve played people usually after cracking the crypt that makes packets find one packet they could spam to server without corrupting the protocol of packets so you don’t get a expell or disconnect right away. They would usally spam a packet that has connection to SQL but overlooked by the creators of the game mostly like a… guild system/ squadron system. Doing a packet event in order extremely fast around 900~1000 packets per second leaving/making a guild system created alot of stress.

Anyways this dupe worked on Diablo, Helbreath, Lineage, Legend Of Mir, MUOnline World of Warcraft all very popular game and yet all had a similar bug.

Runescape only uses SQL on login/logout so its extremely rare that you will get anywhere so just words of wisdom dupes are not as hard as you may think.

As for gold duplication thats also something thats somewhat universal but even more rare to find then database server stress. I ain’t gonna say much about this one cause I have my reasons all I can say as advise, the games client is dumber then the server it self and studing the packet the client sends is the key to doing anything use your minds and send something the client can’t possibly send on its own.[/quote]

Other than the fact that you have no clue what you’re talking about, well, at least it sounds somewhat convincing.

Read full topic

If the database server gets enough stress that it self atleast 20 seconds to process it all thats about 30,000 queries +++

then after you logout and login you could give your item to your friend relog again you will see that you still have the item in your inventory after relogging thats because your data wasn’t really saved but not you FOOLED with the game server’s memory server side yes… you created a item fooling the game server into thinking the player you loaded already has the items which he does do the SQL not updating your information fast enough.

The way this bug worked in many mmorpgs i’ve played people usually after cracking the crypt that makes packets find one packet they could spam to server without corrupting the protocol of packets so you don’t get a expell or disconnect right away. They would usally spam a packet that has connection to SQL but overlooked by the creators of the game mostly like a… guild system/ squadron system. Doing a packet event in order extremely fast around 900~1000 packets per second leaving/making a guild system created alot of stress.

Anyways this dupe worked on Diablo, Helbreath, Lineage, Legend Of Mir, MUOnline World of Warcraft all very popular game and yet all had a similar bug.

Runescape only uses SQL on login/logout so its extremely rare that you will get anywhere so just words of wisdom dupes are not as hard as you may think.

As for gold duplication thats also something thats somewhat universal but even more rare to find then database server stress. I ain’t gonna say much about this one cause I have my reasons all I can say as advise, the games client is dumber then the server it self and studing the packet the client sends is the key to doing anything use your minds and send something the client can’t possibly send on its own.

item.title: Duping, in rs2 ? O.o
item.dc:creator: @belbn belbn
item.description:
@belbn wrote:

There are not alot of dupes. Unless you meaned duped items? Because in rsc people duped and that created a shit load of duped items which got transfer to rs2. But it is alot harder to actually dupe your items now. Basically there are only 2 ways that i know of and 1 of them im not sure about. The first is that they role back your account after trading or buying. Which means you still have your item but the other player has your item and whatever. The other is before an update because they role back accounts then as well.
[/quote]
I dont think you know anything about it. Case closed.

Read full topic
